Hi Alex and welcome,
My advice would be to come to a sword show.  Next month in San Fran, Sept 
there is one in the Chicago area, and Feb down in Florida.  Check Rich's web 
site on reputable dealer links to thier websites.
Mike


>From: "alnsash" <alnsash@...>
>Reply-To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [nihontostudy] newbie
>Date: Wed, 21 Jul 2004 04:55:57 -0000
>
>Hello all!
>I am new to collecting, but have been interested ever since I was
>little. I have picked up several books (and yes, read them) and came
>to the realization that the only way to start expanding my
>understanding from this point is to start making some purchases. The
>question I pose to all here is this:
>Is there any one thing that a new collector should look for above all
>else when making a buy?
>Now, I know this is a very generalized question, but I need to start
>somewhere.
>
>Thanks all!
>
>Alex Bivin
>
>BTW - Would like to thank Mr. Stein for his excellent website! It was
>largely thanks to you that I understand what little I do!
>
